tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE NetworkConfigurations (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    network_name VARCHAR(255),
    ip_address VARCHAR(15),
    subnet_mask VARCHAR(15),
    gateway_address VARCHAR(15),
    dns_server VARCHAR(15)
);

CREATE TABLE network_settings (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    interface_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    ip_address VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    subnet_mask VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL,
    gateway VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE NetworkDevices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    ip_address VARCHAR(15),
    port INT,
    status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE NetworkSettings (
    setting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    setting_name VARCHAR(50),
    setting_value VARCHAR(100),
    FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES NetworkDevices(device_id)
);

CREATE TABLE NetworkLogs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    log_message TEXT,
    log_time TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES NetworkDevices(device_id)
);

CREATE TABLE network_config (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    ip_address VARCHAR(15),
    subnet_mask VARCHAR(15),
    gateway VARCHAR(15),
    dns_server VARCHAR(15)
)

CREATE TABLE device (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    configuration_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (configuration_id) REFERENCES network_config(id)
)

CREATE TABLE network_vlan (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vlan_name VARCHAR(50),
    vlan_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE port_config (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    port_number INT,
    device_id INT,
    vlan_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES device(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (vlan_id) REFERENCES network_vlan(id)
)

CREATE TABLE traffic_log (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR(15),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(15),
    port_number INT,
    vlan_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (port_number) REFERENCES port_config(port_number),
    FOREIGN KEY (vlan_id) REFERENCES network_vlan(id)
)
